game
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  game.Game
Direct Known Subclasses:
TreeGame, Trisentis
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object

Describes a sigma-game or lights-out-game on an arbitrary graph. A graph with n nodes and some edges between them is the basic of the game. A click on one node changes the colour of all neighboured nodes, i.e. of all nodes connected through an edge. The aim is to put all lights on. The class provides some basic functions to examine the kernel and the solutions of such games.

Author:
Irene Thesing

Field Detail

graph

protected GameGraph graph
Graph which describes the sigma-game with nodes 0,...,n-1.

state

protected boolean[] state
Actual state of the game (which lights are on?), There state[i] defines whether the light on node i is on or not.

record

protected boolean[] record
Remembers which nodes was already chosen from #beginRecord(). The order is not relevant.

recordActive

protected boolean recordActive
Whether the moves shall be recorded.

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(int numbStates)
Constructs a new game, only with nodes, without edges. The GameGraph where the edges are defined can be added later for example with #init().

Parameters:
numbStates - number of nodes.

Game

public Game(GameGraph graph,
            boolean[] beginState)
Constructs a new game on the given graph with the given configuration as start values.

Parameters:
graph - graph of the game.
beginState - states for the begin of the game, normally all false.

Game

public Game(GameGraph graph)
Constructs a new game on the given graph with an empty start configuration (all fields 0).

Parameters:
graph - graph of the game.
Method Detail

isRecordActive

public boolean isRecordActive()
Returns whether the record function is on.

Returns:
whether the record function is on.

setRecordActive

public void setRecordActive(boolean recordActive)
Sets the record function on or out.

Parameters:
recordActive - whether the record function shall be activated.

init

protected void init(GameGraph g,
                    int numNodes,
                    boolean[] startConfig)
Initializes this sigma-game. All values are set, so the number of nodes, the graph with the edges as g and a start configuration. Of course the start configuration must have the same length as the count of nodes.

Parameters:
g - the graph where should be played on.
numNodes - the number of nodes.
startConfig - the start configuration for the game.

checkSolution

public boolean checkSolution(boolean[] solution)
Checks if a given boolean vector is a solution of the game in the actual state. Uses that an even number of ones around the state switches the light again out.

Parameters:
solution - a vector which shall be checked.
Returns:
whether the given vector is a solution of this game.

checkKernel

public boolean checkKernel(boolean[] solution)
Checks if a given boolean vector is a kernel element of the game in the actual state. Uses that an even number of ones around the state switches the light again out.

Parameters:
solution - a vector which shall be checked.
Returns:
whether the given vector is a kernel element of this game.

getKernel

public java.util.List<boolean[]> getKernel()
Calculates a linear independent system of kernel elements. The trivial kernel element is given, too.

Returns:
list with linear independent kernel elements and the first element as zero, since it is the trivial kernel element.

getAllKernel

public java.util.LinkedList<boolean[]> getAllKernel()
Calculates all kernel elements, not only a base. For details see #BooleanMatrix.computeAllCore() .

Returns:
a list of all kernel elements.

getAllSolutions

public java.util.LinkedList<boolean[]> getAllSolutions()
Calculates all possible solutions by calculating one solution and adding all kernel elements.

Returns:
a list of all solutions.

getSolutions

public java.util.List<boolean[]> getSolutions()
Calculates some solutions of the game, in fact as many as the kernel dimension is.

Returns:
list with solution elements.

getSolutions

public java.util.List<boolean[]> getSolutions(boolean[] config)
Calculates solutions of the game beginning with the given configuration.

Parameters:
config - start configuration.
Returns:
list with some solutions elements.

getOneSolution

public boolean[] getOneSolution(boolean[] config)
Calculates only one solution of the game beginning with the start configuration

Parameters:
config - start configuration.
Returns:
a solution of Adj(#graph) X = config.

play

public void play(int m)
Clicks on a node and makes the correspdonding move. That is changing all boolean values of the fields around this node-

Parameters:
m - node which is clicked.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The string representation of the game is done by the graph and the actual state.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
string representation of the game.

isWon

public boolean isWon()
The game is won, if all nodes are marked, i.e. have the value true. This method return whether the game is won in the actual state or not,

Returns:
whether the game is won in the actual state.

setRecord

public void setRecord(boolean activate)
Begins to record the moves (value true) and ends it (with value false).

Parameters:
activate - whether record shall be started or ended.

getRecord

public boolean[] getRecord()
Returns a history of the moves (without order) from beginRecord() on. So the played moves can be visualized.

Returns:
the record of the moves.

changeState

public void changeState(int number)
Changes the actual state in the node with the given number to true if it was false and to false if it was true.

Parameters:
number - the number of the node whose state shall be changed.
